p: The Sub-Chronic toxicity study was conducted as prescribed in the OECD [ 37], N0. 425 test guidelines; described by Route et al. [ 38] and Oliveira et al. [ 39]. A total of twenty-four (24) male Wistar rats were utilized in this phase of the study and were allowed access to food and drinking water ad libitum. The rats were distributed into four (4) groups of n = 6. Test animals received 500, 1000, and 2000 mg/kg body weight, respectively, of AESG daily for thirty (30) days; while the control group received only rat pellets and water.
